joelib2.math
Class CoordinateTransformation

java.lang.Object
  joelib2.math.CoordinateTransformation
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class CoordinateTransformation
extends Object
implements Serializable

An object for storing, manipulating and applying coordinate transformations. The most basic way to setup a transformation is to use the member methodName setup(double []), which requires you to supply a specific set of 4 coordinates from the initial reference frame in the final reference frame. The methodName setup(double [], double [], int) will set up a transformation given an arbitrary set of coordinates in the final and initial reference frame. A rotation/translation or a translation/rotation can also be supplied, see the various member functions begining with Setup.

Applying the transformation The transform(double[], int) member methodName applies the objects transform to a set of coordinates.

Utilities:
The invert() member methodName will reverses the current transformation such that it changes what was originally the final reference frame into what was originally the initial reference frame. A rotation/translation or translation/rotation cooresponding to the objects transformation can be extracted, see the various member functions begining with Get. The #add(JOECoordTrans) and #adding(JOECoordTrans) are also defined for combining transformation.

Note:
This object can only handle transformations that can be described with Euler angles (i.e., No inversions). Several member methodName will take rotation matricies as input, however, it is assumed that these matricies only apply simple rotations that can be described with Euler angles.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

add

public final CoordinateTransformation add(CoordinateTransformation ct2)
Combine two transformations. Obviously the communative property does not apply hence, ct1+ct2 is \b not the same as ct2+ct1.

Parameters:
ct2 - Second transformation
Returns:
A transformation equivilant to applying (*this) and then ct2.

adding

public CoordinateTransformation adding(CoordinateTransformation ct)
Changes this transform to the orginal transform followed by an additional transform.

Parameters:
ct - The additional coordinate transformation.
Returns:
A transform equivilant to the original transform followed by the transform given in ct. Note that the communative property does not apply so this is \b not the same as applying ct then the original transform.

clear

public void clear()
Clears the object as if it were just constructed.

getEulerTranslation

public final void getEulerTranslation(double[] euler,
                                      double[] trans)
Returns a \b rotation and \b translation (applied in that order) corresponding to this objects transformation.

Parameters:
euler - A length 3 array that will be returned with euler angles of the rotation. The angles are applied in the following order around the following axis. euler[0] rotation about the z-axis, euler[1] rotation about the x-axis and euler[2] rotation about the z-axis.
trans - A length 3 array that will be returned with the x,y and z components of the translation.

getRmatrixTranslation

public final void getRmatrixTranslation(double[] rmat,
                                        double[] trans)
Returns a \b rotation and \b translation (applied in that order) coresponding to this objects transformation.

Parameters:
rmat - A length 9 array that will be returned with the elements of a rotation matrix. rmat[3*i+j] is the value of the element in the i'th row and j'th column.
trans - A length 3 array that will be returned with the x,y and z components of the translation.

getRmatrixTranslation

public void getRmatrixTranslation(BasicMatrix3D rmatrix,
                                  BasicVector3D tvec)
Returns a \b rotation and \b translation (applied in that order) coresponding to this objects transformation.

Parameters:
rmatrix - A Matrix3x3 that will be returned with the rotation.
tvec - A Vector that will be returned with the translation.

getTranslationEuler

public final void getTranslationEuler(double[] trans,
                                      double[] euler)
Returns a \b translation and \b rotation (applied in that order) coresponding to this objects transformation.

Parameters:
trans - A length 3 array that will be returned with the x,y and z components of the translation.
euler - A length 3 array that will be returned with euler angles of the rotation. The angles are applied in the following order around the following axis. euler[0] rotation about the z-axis, euler[1] rotation about the x-axis and euler[2] rotation about the z-axis.

invert

public void invert()
Inverts this objects transformation. (i.e., instead of converting from reference frame 1 to 2 it now converts from 2 to 1.)

setup

public boolean setup(double[] in_xyz)
Core function to setup the coordinate transformation.

Parameters:
in_xyz - A length 12 array containing 4 coordinates (0,0,0), (1,0,0), (0,1,0) and (0,0,1) from the initial reference frame transformed into the final reference frame
Returns:
true if o.k.

setup

public void setup(double[] init_xyz,
                  double[] final_xyz,
                  int n)
Sets up a coordinate transformation from an arbitrary set of coordinates in the initial and final reference frame. Note that this procedure \b will deal with the case of N = 0,1 or 2. In the case of N=0 the identity transform is returned. In the case of N=1 the appropriate translation, without and translation is returned. In the case of N=2 there are multiple degenerate transformations, and a correct, but arbitrary, transformation is returned.
init_xyz and final_xyz must be identical sets of coordinates except for the frame of reference.

Parameters:
init_xyz - An array with the coordinates in the initial reference frame.
final_xyz - Description of the Parameter
n - Description of the Parameter

setupEulerTranslation

public void setupEulerTranslation(double[] euler,
                                  double[] trans)
Sets up this objects transformation based on a specified \b rotation and \b translation (applied in that order).
This member methodName is distinct from setupTranslationEuler . The transformation setup in this methodName applies the rotation before the translation.

Parameters:
euler - A length 3 array with euler angles. euler[0] is a rotation about the z-axis, euler[1] is a rotation about the x-axis and euler[2] is a rotation about the z-axis. The Euler rotations are applied in the order listed. \b IMPORTANT: Angles are in \b radians.
trans - A length 3 array with the x,y and z translations.
See Also:
setupTranslationEuler(double [], double[])

setupRmatrixTranslation

public void setupRmatrixTranslation(double[] rmat,
                                    double[] trans)
Sets up this objects transformation based on a specified \b rotation and \b translation (applied in that order). This member methodName is distinct from setupTranslationRmatrix() . This transformation setup in this methodName applies the rotation before the translation.

Parameters:
rmat - A length 9 array representing the rotation matrix. rmat[3*i+j] is the value of the element in the i'th row and j'th column.
trans - A length 3 array with the x,y and z translations.
See Also:
setupTranslationRmatrix(double[], double[])

Parameters:
